parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Badly, evilly, wrongly. From kakos; badly.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
A disease, malady, sickness. Of uncertain affinity; a malady.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
